Welcome to tensorshare’s documentation!¶

Tensorshare allows sharing of PyTorch tensors across multiple remote computers with few lines of code.

Sending and receiving of tensors is handled via an adapted version of FTP that keeps received objects in memory instead of writing them to the disk. Additionally, clients can subscribe to receive notifications on changed values, allowing to update those immediately. Lastly, a wrapper around tensorshare for Distributed Deep Reinforcment Learning (DDRL) applications is included.

tensorshare was written with DDRL in mind, but it can also be used to parallelize expensive computations during training sample creation. E.g. searching for suitable triplets in large datasets when training triplet networks may be distributed onto multiple machines with tensorshare.
